Merci really hopes that the loan assistance will help her to cover the entire cost of repairs and to buy more petrol to sell.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her minivan and to buy more petrol to sell.

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21.  She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, she grows corn and owns/operates a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community.   

She has been in the farming business for over six years and has been working to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation.  Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP in order to help purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo's main source of income comes from his gardening business. He is 43 years old and married with 2 kids. He is from Tonggo, Jimenez and been gardening for 2 years, earning an amount of 3,200 PHP a month. This year, Danilo joined GDMPC. Danilo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 39-year-old businesswoman from the village of Cabisera 17-21, province of Isabela.  She is married to Ruben who is also her business partner.  They have two children and both of them are studying.  

Nora and her husband run a livestock business as their main source of income.  Her husband is responsible for purchasing live cows and carabaos (a type of water buffalo) from different villages and for selling in the province of Pangasinan.  Nora is in charge of looking for a good animal to purchase.  The couple has been in this business since their children were young.  She is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional livestock.  It will help the business to be more profitable because she knows that the more livestock they sell, the greater profits they will generate.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Abelito

texts.en: Abelito is a 29-year-old resident of Tonggo, Tudela. Abelito supports his family's needs with the little amount of 3,100 Philippine pesos (PHP) that he makes monthly from his gardening business. He has been in this business for two years. However, this year he's been a member of GDMPC, and he applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Abelito wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants for his gardening business

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka, de 38 años es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, esta casada recientemente con el hombre que la acompaña desde hace muchos años, tiene 2 hijos y junto a ellos vive en su casa propia brindándoles todo lo que necesitan gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo y a la ayuda incondicional que recibe de su esposo. 
La actividad laboral de Milka consiste en brindar servicio de peluquería y estética en general. Tiene un local acondicionado en su vivienda en donde atiende a los clientes que requieren de algún corte de cabello, tintes, iluminaciones y otros, del mismo modo realiza masajes desestresantes, tratamientos capilares, cuidado faciales y otorga servicio de maquillaje, peinados, tratamientos de pies y manos a señoras o señoritas que acudirán a eventos o reuniones sociales como matrimonios o celebraciones de 15 años. Tiene tarifas establecidas para cada uno de los servicios que brinda y gracias  a los precios cómodos y a la calidad de su trabajo siempre es muy solicitada. Lleva en este negocio más de 10 años y trabaja sola. Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando aprendió mucho y reforzó algunos tratamientos que ya conocía, agradece mucho a la vida porque le está yendo bien, es conciente que tiene que trabajar mucho para poder tener éxito en este tipo de trabajo porque hay mucha competencia, espera continuar manteniendo su clientela y así seguir creciendo hasta establecer su propia tienda de cosméticos en donde pueda tener mejores ingresos. Este es el préstamo individual número 3 con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse muy confiada trabajando con la institución pues considera que le están brindando todas las facilidades para ser una buena socia.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3000), comprará diversos artículos que usa en su trabajo como tintes, champú, cremas relajantes, diversos cosméticos para maquillaje y otros accesorios femeninos para ponerlos a la venta dentro de su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Milka is 38 years old and a very hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s recently married to the man she’s been with for many years.  They have two children and they live together in her home and she provides them with everything they need thanks to the effort she puts forth and her husband’s unconditional support.  

Milka is a hairstylist and general beautician.  She has a well set up shop in her home, where she services customers who need haircuts, tints, highlights, and other things.  She also gives massages, anti-stress treatments, capillary treatments, facials, and does makeovers, hairstyles, and hand and foot treatments for women who will be attending social events or services like weddings, and 15 year celebrations.   

She has set rates for each of her services and thanks to the comfortable prices and the quality of her work, she is always well sought after.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years and works alone.  She has learned a lot of new things and reinforced her training in other treatments during the time she’s been working.  She greatly appreciates life because things are going well for her and she knows that she can be successful if she works hard.  There is a lot of competition.

She expects to keep her customers and be able to continue growing until she can establish her own cosmetic store, where she can increase her income.  This will be her third loan through MFP and she is grateful for the support given her so that she can continue with her business and advance her plans.  She tells us that she is very comfortable working with the institution because it’s providing her all the knowledge she needs to be a good partner.

She will use the money from this loan (S/3,000) to buy different items that she uses in her work, such as tints, shampoos, relaxation creams, various types of cosmetics, and other feminine products to sell from her establishment.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 54 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them. Celia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc., in her general store. Celia has been in her business for seven years. In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador  y empeñoso, además de solidario y amable con muchos deseos de superación, Vive junto a su conviviente Neria quien es empleada, fruto de esa unión tiene 02 hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad, al los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Orlando es el dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un motocarro que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular iniciándose de esa manera hace 12 años cuando se compró su primera unidad, y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando a otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano. 
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares, iniciándose por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar su propio tiempo, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados, por eso tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse un vehiculo de transporte de carga pesada. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera ser buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como ropa masculina para esta campaña navideña, ya que le dio esa idea su tía que también vende ropas.
texts.en:
Orlando is 47 years old and a hardworking, enterprising man.  He is also friendly and has a great desire to succeed.  He lives with his wife Neria who works.  They have two children, ages 17 and 19 whom they love very much.  They all live comfortably in a home of their own.

Orlando transports passanges in a moto-taxi that he bought with his savings and a private loan.  He started this 12 years ago when he bought his first vehicle and over time he renovated others as they wore out from constant use.

He likes his business because it allows him to have an income that he can use to cover his family expenses and he started it because he could not find work and needed an income.  Now he is comfortable and can manage his own schedule; he’s also his own boss.  However, he doesn’t like when his moto-taxi malfunctions so often and it creates a lot of expenses.  Still, he is able to see good results and plans to grow and buy a new heavy freight vehicle.

This will be his 10th loan through MFP and he feels grateful for the financial support that has helped him reach his objectives.  He also says that he’s comfortable with his communal bank and gets along well with all the members, whom he considers to be good people.

He will use the 1,000 PEN to buy merchandise such as men’s clothing for the Christmas season, since he got the idea to also sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson, tiene 50 años, es un hombre emprendedor, honesto y muy trabajador, esta casado con Rita y junto a ella tiene 3 hijos de 21, 15 y 13 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia al lado de toda su familia compartiendo ahí el día a día de trabajo, esfuerzo y lucha por seguir adelante.
El trabajo principal de Wilson consiste en la venta de diversos abarrotes para el consumo humano, principalmente arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, panes, condimentos, fideos y otros. Su trabajo se inicia con la compra de todo lo que necesita para realizar sus ventas, Luego se traslada mediante transporte fluvial hacia las comunidades nativas o centros poblados asentados en la ribera de los ríos. Viaja cada 3 o 4 días y retorna a la ciudad tras haber vendido toda su mercadería. Realiza ésta actividad hace 7 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en aquellos pequeños pueblos se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos y los de su familia. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 4000), comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, panes, aceite, fideos, atún y condimentos al por mayor para realizar su trabajo con mayor énfasis.
texts.en:
Wilson is 50 years old and he is an entrepreneurial, honest, and hard working man. He is married to Rita and together they have three children that are 21, 15, and 13 years old respectively. He lives in his own home next to his whole family sharing the day-to-day work, effort, and drive to get ahead. 

The main work on Wilson is to sell various groceries for human consumption, primarily rice, sugar, eggs, bread, spices, noodles, and other items.  His work begins with the purchase of all that he needs to complete his sales. Then he moves by means of the river transportation toward the native communities or populated centers that are located in the riverbanks. He travels every 3 or 4 days and returned to the city after he has sold all of his merchandise.  He has been doing this work for 7 years.  He does it with more emphasis when the small villages have some festivity or important celebration. 

He likes that his work will allow him to interact with people.  It gives him vitality and a lot of energy to be in constant physical activity. He especially feels happy because he can generate his own income to continue settle his expenses and those of his family. 

This is his 5th loan. He is very happy knowing that he has financial support because it will allow him to feel more secure advancing his work. Likewise he promises to another time to complete with the punctual payments as he did with the previous loans that he had.  With the amount requested  (S/. 4000) he will buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, oil, noodles tuna and wholesale spices to complete his work  with a lot of enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, oil, noodles tuna and wholesale spices

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, esta divorciada. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijas de 21 y 17 años, quienes la ayudan en los que haceres del hogar, su casa es propia, la cual logro construir con el apoyo de sus hijas. El trabajo que realiza Mirta  es la  venta de ropas para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos que están a la moda, los cuales trae a pedido, contando con muchos clientes, esta actividad la realiza de modo ambulatorio, y reparto a domicilio, ya lleva como 5 años en éste negocio, la cual lo realiza sola pero de manera muy alegre. Paralelo también realiza la otra actividad que es el transporte, esta actividad viene realizando hace ocho meses, lo realiza sola. Lo que le gusta de ésta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual poder tener un sustento para la economía de su hogar, se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones. Tiene ganas de seguir trabajando y buscar un negocio rentable, por eso tiene planes de comprar un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros de mayor capacidad como una combi. Por tanto éste será el 01 préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindad de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Así como también se siente a gusto con su banco comunal ya considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará más ropas de niños y damas para de esta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Mirta is 40 years old and is a happy, dynamic, and enterprising woman.  She is divorced and lives with her two daughters, ages 21 and 17 who help her with the household shores.  She owns her home and was able to build it with her daughters’ help.

Mirta sells stylish men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing of various brands and styles.  She has many customers and sells on foot and also from her home and has been doing this for five years; alone but very happily.  She also provides transportation.  She started doing this eight months ago.  What she likes is that it generates an income that allows her to financially sustain her home.  She is happy and very satisfied.

She wants to continue working and looking for a profitable business, so she plans to buy a better vehicle to transport passengers, such as a van.  Therefore, this will be her first loan through MFP.  She is very happy with this opportunity and is committed to being on time with her payments.  She is also happy with her communal bank and considers the member to be united and responsible.

She will use the 800 PEN from this loan to buy more clothing for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to manage his inventory and sales using Tiendatek

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is married and has two daughters. Their names are Fortunate (3 years old) and Abigail (5 months old). Her husband is currently enrolled in an adult education course.

Catherine is a full-time teacher and a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar
Sister, Catherine had learned marketing and business skills. She also enjoys being a Solar Sister because it has helped her make new friends.

With the income she earns as a Solar Sister, Catherine helps to purchase school supplies for her children and also contributes to the purchase of scholastic materials for her husband’s education course. She was also able to save money and purchase a freezer so that she can make ice cream treats for her pupils.

Catherine dreams of becoming one of the best teachers in the world. She also dreams of having a nice house and a successful solar sales operation, and would like to see her children receive a good education.

loans.use: To purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community

loans.name: Junito

texts.en:
Junito, 40 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Tonggo, Tudela. He has three children. He makes his living from his gardening business. He has run the business for almost four years now and he earns PHP 4,000 a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC micro-credit, which he just joined recently. Junito is taking the loan in order to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Before long, he’s hopeful about the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a ambulant tobacco-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of tobacco to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson is a hardworking and patient father. He lives with his wife, who is also a very loving person. The family has been farming for six years. He has applied for this loan to develop his farm. He plans to purchase chemicals, fertilizer and seed to grow which will allow him to make more income. Farm products are in great demand, not only in the city, but also in the region. Meeting this demand will allow Robinson to increase his income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer and seed for his farming business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with six children. Lilian is 62 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Lilian sells different types of snacks to earn a living, and she has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. 

Lilian has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase more stock items for her snack vending business. In the future, Lilian hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 27 years old. She is married to Roberto. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with two children. 

To generate income, Jonalyn is engaged in cooking and selling native cakes in her village. She has been in her village for two years and earns about 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) a day. 

Right now, Jonalyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook and sell such as sugar, coconut and flour. She is determined and patient to improve her business to supplement the needs of her family. Her profit will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook and sell such as sugar, coconut and flour.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 
Edna has a store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other items. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 Pesos to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and more. In the future, Edna hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap etc.

loans.name: Primo

texts.en: Primo is from Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. Primo operates a gardening business for a living. Primo has been in his business for six years and earns PHP 3,000 a month. This year, Primo joined GDMPC. Primo is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: I Wayan decided to apply for a new loan to increase his business raising pigs. With this new loan, he plans to purchase superior piglets and feed. He plans to raise pigs for fattening. With a 24-month loan cycle, he can sell pigs many times. He hopes his plan runs smoothly. With full support from his wife, he runs the business at home and also works at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Geramie

texts.en:
Geramie works hard to support her family. Geramie is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Geramie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Geramie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Geramie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lorlain

texts.en:
Lorlain  is 45 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Lorlain has a store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits and candies, among many other items.  She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more stock, such as shampoo, for her general store.
Lorlain has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lorlain hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as shampoo, for her general store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 59 years old. She is a mixed crop farmer and is also involved in hog-raising. She and her husband Gabriel are blessed with five children. She has been in the farming business for the past 22 years and has a monthly income of 5,000 PHP, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for a loan of 35,000 PHP. Elena will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. She anticipates profit from the business and will use it for her children's education. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into rice farming.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and seedlings for her farm business

loans.name: Byamba

texts.en: Mr. Byamba is 24 years old and lives with his newly wedded wife in a Ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife, Tsendjav, is helping him start his own new business of firewood and charcoal sales. The borrower has graduated from a special training school as a welder and plumber. He has been working as an assistant worker for a private company for the last few years. He just got married, is having a baby soon and needs more money for family expenses. He decided to start his own firewood and charcoal retail business in order to increase his income. He is now requesting 1'500'000 MNT to purchase large amounts of firewood and charcoal to resell in Ulaanbaatar at a higher price. He is hardworking, responsible and a helpful person.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of firewood and charcoal to resell in Ulaanbaatar at a higher price

loans.name: Sariou

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Sariou est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le moins âgé a 14ans. Elle vend de la potasse et d'argile depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Age 36, Sariou is married with four children, two of whom are in school. The youngest is 14. She has sold potash and clay for several years. She gets her products from another market. In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customers' demand, she has requested and received a loan from Finadev in order to make her business more interesting and to contribute to her children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of potash and clay.

loans.name: Adelaide's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux membres en caution solidaire. Adélaïde la responsable est âgée de 39ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dans une école de la place, l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 17ans et 9ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des produits cosmétiques depuis quelques années, elle  s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de couvrir les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la bonne éducation de ses enfants. Adélaïde se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group made up of two members with joint liability. Adélaïde who is responsible for the group is 39 years old. She is married and mother to three children, who all attend a local school. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest nine. Adélaïde has been specialising in the sale of cosmetics for several years and she gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. With a view to increasing her turnover and providing for her customers' needs, she has requested and been granted a loan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximise her supplementary income and to contribute to giving her children a good education. Adélaïde is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of pomade, 1/2 box of soap and 1/2 a box of perfume

loans.name: Yvette Claire

texts.fr: Agée de 53ans, Yvette Claire est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 30ans et 21ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire.
texts.en:
Yvette Claire, age 53, is married and the mother of three children who are already independent.  Her oldest and youngest children are 30 and 21 years old, respectively.

Yvette Claire has been specializing in the sale of "pagnes" (traditional African fabrics) for a few years, and she buys her merchandise from a market in Benin and from a market in another country.

Eager to increase her capital and to fulfill her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  This loan will allow her to make some additional income and to contribute to her children's education

loans.use: to buy 20 "pagnes".

loans.name: Colette's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 41 ans, Colette la responsable est mariée et mère de 04 enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 21ans et 12ans. Colette commercialise des fournitures scolaires à domicile depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaires et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Colette se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group with two female members who are mutual guarantors. Colette is the head of the group. She is 41 years of age, married, and a mother to four children who are at school. Her oldest child is 21, while the youngest is 12 years of age. 

Colette works selling school supplies from home, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to increase her sales and meet her customers' needs, she has requested and obtained a microloan to maximize her profits, as well as to provide for her children's education. Colette is pictured on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of notepads and one box of books.

loans.name: Malomon

texts.fr: Malomon est âgée de 56ans. Mariée et mère de six enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 38ans et 25ans. Elle commercialise des condiments et des céréales depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire à la demande de ses clients, Malomon a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Fiandev. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par cet appui financier lui permettra d'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Malomon, age 56, is a married mother of six independent children aged 25 to 38. She has been selling condiments and cereals for a few years, and she buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her working capital and meet the needs of her customers, she obtained a loan from Finadev. The additional revenue earned through this credit will allow her to help support her customers’ education and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes, 2 baskets of peppers, 5 jugs of oil, 2 sacks of cassava flour, 1 bag of beans and 4 bags of maize.

loans.name: Nicole Ndimah

texts.fr: Nicole est une femme de 38 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants (6 ans et 3 ans). Elle possède et gère un call-center ambulant dans un coin de la ville depuis 3 ans où elle vend des crédits de communications, confiserie, biscuits, cheepse etc. Dynamique et accueillant, elle considère que son stock de crédits est déjà insuffisant pour sa clientèle grandissante. le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs (Orange et MTN). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et avoir un mini kiosque d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation)
texts.en: Nicole is a 38 year old woman. She is single and has two children (6 and 3 years old). She has owned and managed a mobile call center in part of the city for the past three years, where she sells phone credit, candy, cookies, chips etc. Dynamic and welcoming, she noticed that her stock of phone credit isn't sufficient for her growing client base. The loan that she is taking will allow her to buy phone credit in bulk direct from suppliers (Orange and MTN). The profits she will make will in part allow increase her working capital and get a small kiosk, and also allow her to meet her family's needs (food and education).

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credit

loans.name: Aurelie Noel

texts.fr: Aurélie est un femme de 41 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle possède et gère une mini boutique de vente de denrée alimentaire dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle dispose d'une clientèle considérable malgré sa petite expérience. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter de l'huile et des mouchoir pour pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Aurelie is 41 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children.  She has owned and managed a small grocery shop in a district of her city for two years.  She has a considerable clientele in spite of her short experience.  With this loan she would like to buy oil and handkerchiefs in order to respond better to her customers’ demands.  Her income will allow her to meet the needs of her family and to expand her business

loans.use: to buy oil and tissues to sell

loans.name: Célestin

texts.fr: Célestin est âgé de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestin a un peu fréquenté l'école. Célestin est marié à une marchande du nom de Odette. Le couple a treize enfants, dont neuf sont leurs propres enfants, et un ne vit plus avec eux. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Célestin mène comme activité l’agriculture depuis une trentaine d'année. Dans le but de rehausser son activité, Célestin sollicite pour la sixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement d'acheter des intrants pour cultiver le niébé, du gombo et du piment pour satisfaire la demande de ces clients. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Célestin is 42 years old and lives in Benin. He has had a bit of schooling. Célestin is married to a trader called Odette. The couple have 13 children. Nine of them are their own, and one no longer lives with them.  

Célestin has been a farmer for about 30 years, in order to be able to take care of the family's different expenses. He is requesting a loan for the 6th time from ALIDé, with the aim of increasing his level of business activity. This loan will help him to buy the agricultural inputs needed to cultivate black-eyed peas, okra and peppers, so that he can satisfy his customer demand. The first loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to cultivate black-eyed peas, okra and peppers.

loans.name: Kokué

texts.fr: Kokuè  est revendeuse de sacs hors saison, ou sac de friperie dans un marché de la place depuis 1994. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et  mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés.  Son premier enfant a 26 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour se ravitailler en sacs. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et avoir d’autres lieux de vente mais également assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Kokuè has been a reseller of bags off season, or bags of secondhand clothing in a local market since 1994. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of 3 children of whom 2 go to school. Her first child is 26 years old and the youngest is 18 years old. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to resupply herself in bags. She wishes to expand her business and have other selling locations but also ensure the self-fulfillment of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
To continue the business and earn more profit, the Sri Cendana Group is requesting a new loan. They are asking for a loan for the same member as before. The loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed and to renovate the cage.
Ni Ketut used her loans to purchase two piglets for 400.000 IDR each, and the rest to buy feeds. She has a plan to keep pigs for fattening. This time the profit will be used for supporting her children's education. She hopes that next period MUK will give a bigger loan because the price for feed is getting more expensive. Two of the members can’t attend the meeting because of illness and having to attend a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and renovate the cage

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is married with two children. Joel is 41 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Joel operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years. He earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this type of business. To improve his transportation services he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. Joel has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Joel hopes to have another motorcycle to make more earnings for his family's needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles Nucléaires, les quatre femmes du groupe  Djiguitougou  ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Bagadadji dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Bagadadji de Ségou. Elles font l’achat et la vente des galettes, des produits cosmétiques (parfums, crèmes à peau et à lèvres), des draps de lit, des habits  d’enfants, des pagnes wax et brodés. Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui, elles sont à leur 7ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Djénébou  (femme en 1ère position sur la photo de la  gauche   vers droite) est une grande vendeuse d’habits de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes au grand marché de Ségou. Elle effectue ses ventes en détails au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, à domicile et en ambulant. Avec ce prêt, Djénébou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and in nuclear families, the four women of the group Djiguitougou are on average 34 years old and have 2 children. They all live in the Bagadadji neighborhood in the town of Ségou and met through neighborhood ties and their income-generating businesses at the Bagadadji market in Ségou. They buy and sell cakes, cosmetic products (perfumes, skin and lip creams), bed sheets, children's clothing, wax and embroidered pagnes [colorful African fabric]. Concerned with increasing their businesses, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with which they are on their 7th solidarity group loan cycle.

Djénébou (the woman in the 1st position in the photo from left to right) is a great seller of clothing of all kinds. She plans to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of pagnes (colorful African wax cloth) at the large market in Ségou. She carries out her sales retail for cash and credit to a clientèle made up primarily of women, from home and as an itinerant saleswoman. With this loan, Djénébou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of certain needs of the home.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African wax cloth)

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Гулсара родилась в г.Жалал-Абад, ей 53 года, семейное положение замужем,  проживает со своей семьей в г.Жалал-Абад. Заемщица после окончания средней школы г.Жалал-Абад вышла замуж. Мать пятерых детей. Вместе с мужем начали разводить крупно рогатый.
Заемщица в настоящее время   занимается  животноводством, в этой сфере занимается с 1992 года. Бизнес начинала с 5,000 KGS. Постепенно развиваясь и увеличивая оборотные средства, увеличила количество голов скота, обучила детей.В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульсара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) На всю сумму полученного кредита планирует купить 2 коровы и 5 баранов для разведения и реализации.
Заемщица планирует в будущем создать большую ферму для разведения КРС и МРС. После получения прибыли от данной деятельности заемщица планирует купить автомобиль для мужа. 
За период подготовки необходимых документов и проведения финансового анализа заемщица  показала себя с положительной стороны, как человек ответственный,  порядочный, добросовестный, предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать денежные средства в нужное направление. У заемщицы имеется сарай и все необходимые условия для выпаса и содержания скота.
texts.en:
Gulsara is 53 years old and lives in the town of Jalal-Abad. She got married soon after graduating from high school, and is now a mother of five children. Together with her husband, Gulsara started raising livestock in 1992, launching the new business with an investments of 5,000 KGS. By gradually developing her business and increasing her working capital, Gulsara was able to expand her herd, and also to pay for her children's education.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulsara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She plans to used the entire amount to purchase 2 cows and 5 sheep for breeding and subsequent resale. In the future, Gulsara plans to build a large farm for raising large and small livestock. She plans to use her profits from this loan to buy a car for her husband.

During the financial analysis and preparation of documents for this loan, Gulsara has shown her positive character as a person who is responsible, decent, conscientious, industrious, and able to take good care of her business and invest her funds well. She has a barn and all necessities for feeding and raising livestock.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and 5 sheep

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 55 years old, married and has five children. She has operated her retail store in their village for seven years and she earns approximately 300 PHP per day. She wants to request a loan from Kiva lenders of 25,000 PHP to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store. She is patient and determined to improve her business in order to supplement the needs of her family. Her profit will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Janvier

texts.fr: janvier est un homme de 26 marié, père d'un enfant. Il a ouvert et gère une blanchisserie depuis  10 ans. Elle fonctionne normalement mais pour aller plus vite dans ses livraisons et pour mieux satisfaite sa clientèle, il nous sollicite pour la mise en place d'u_n crédit d'un montant de 250.000FCFa pour s'acheter une nouvelle machine à laver. Le bénéfice que lui apoortera ce crédit sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de quitter la mainson familiale.
texts.en:
Janvier is a 26-year-old man, who is married and the father of one child.  

Ten years ago he opened a laundry, which he has been running since then.  His business is going well, but in order to provide a faster delivery service and to better satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from us, in the amount of 250,000 CFA francs.  

He will use this loan to buy a new washing machine.  

Profits from Janvier's loan will be reinvested in part in his activity, while the rest will allow him to leave his parents' house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Siuzike, leader du groupe d’affaire «Umoja ni nguvu », elle est entrepreneur, âgée d’environ 47 ans, mariée, mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un officiel de l’Etat. Elle est sociétaire d’un restaurant. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles de crédits dans le programme Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 paniers de pommes de terre, 5 litres de huile, 12 kg des farines, 2 casiers de Fanta, lait, tomates, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroitre son entreprise. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables
texts.en:
Siuzike, the leader of the business group called "Umoja ni nguvu", is an entrepreneur approximately 47 years old, married and the mother of three young children. Her husband is a government official; she is a partner in a restaurant, and has been doing this for ten years now. Nonetheless, she has recently completed her tenth loan cycle in the Hekima credit programme. She will use this new loan to purchase three baskets of potatoes, five litres of oil, twelve kilogrammes of flour, two cases of Fanta, milk, tomatoes, etc. Furthermore, she wants to see her children grow up and build her business. 
The client welcomes Hekima's initiative in favour of poor, unbanked women.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business, such as potatoes, oil, flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: From the village of Cabisera 17-21, hardworking and diligent, Rubelyn is married and manages her own store, selling a variety of products in the community. Rubelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, and soap for her store to earn additional income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, and soap for her store.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in the Cabisera 17-21 province of Isabela. She is 48 years old and is married. Lydia has three grown up children. She is involved in agriculture, and primarily sows crops for sale. She has been in this business for nine years. Lydia is requesting this loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seed for her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru: Зайнура 53 года, замужем. Зайнура в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 1,500 сом (KGS) 17 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Зайнура смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 1 корова  и 11 голов овец. Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства, Зайнура оплачивает затраты на основные нужды семьи. Зайнура занимается откормом баранов "Гисарской" породы с последующей продажи по мимо этого Зайнура  продает с дома молоко и молочную продукцию. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зайнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дополнительных голов овец. В этом году цена на баранов низкая. Доходы от кредита Зайнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет осуществить свою давлению мечту,Сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zainura is 53 years old and married. As her main source of income, Zainura raises livestock. Having started this business 17 years ago with a sum of 1,500 som (KGS), through hard work she has been able to make it grow so that it presently brings her 12,000 som (KGS) per month. Currently, Zainura keeps 1 cow and 11 sheep. She raises sheep of the Gissar breed for subsequent sale, and also sells milk and dairy products from home. Thanks to her business profits, Zainura can pay for her family's basic needs.

In order to continue developing her business, Zainura has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional sheep, whose price is low this year. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and in the future hopes to realize her long-time dream of performing major renovations in her house.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Wayan, head of the Suta Pertiwi group, 47, lives with his wife. He’s only has 1 child; his child works in the city of Denpasar. In his daily, Wayan is a farmer. He plants many kinds of crops, like peanut, chili peppers, cucumbers, and watermelons
.
This rainy season, the group is preparing to plant new seeds. They hope the weather supports their plan. With the loan amount of 22,500,000 IDR, they will       purchase seeds and fertilizer.

2 of the members couldn’t attend the meeting because they were at the temple; they are represented by their wives.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en: Ni Putu  is succeeding in maintaining her pigs, and her husband supports her business because the profits help to improve the family's income. She also successfully renovated the barn. Now she needs a new loan to purchase four super-quality piglets because these piglets grow faster with good quality feed. Because the loan is not enough to purchase all four pigs, her husband will give her money to support her business. She hopes the piglets will grow fast and healthy so she can sell them to other breeders in her village at a high price.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is married with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Corazon cultivates a rice farm to earn a living. She earns 9,400 PHP every month. She has been in this business for 6 years. Corazon has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next harvest. Corazon been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm production business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next planting.

loans.name: Sawe Puncak Indah Group

texts.en:
Sawe Puncak Indah group is a group of village women who are all pig farmers. They have joined together as a group to get funding and training from MUK.

Ni Ketut is married with 3 children who are still in school. Ni Ketut is using her new loan to buy four piglets that she will fatten up for 5 months. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy pig feed.

Ni Ketut spent 5,000 IDR for her kitchen and 100,000 IDR to pay for electricity and water. Although her business is still small, Ni Ketut hope this business can support her children's educationby allowing her to buy books and other school items, in addition to kitchens tools.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms Shameem is a 42-year-old, an energetic married woman. She has been doing a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing which is a material used in making 'charpoy' (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She has 10 years of experience in this field. 


She offers various kinds of 'waan' in different colors, and she is famous for providing a good quality product to her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Her husband is an employee in a sugar mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members. 

Shameen is a mother of six children. She requires improving her business so she applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy another 'waan'-making machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy another 'waan'-making machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en:
Ms. Sahira is 32-year-old woman and has been running a garment business with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Sahira’s husband. They have great collection of clothes to offer to their customers.  She is a mother of five children; she is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to improve her earnings she needs to expand her business. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more garments for her collection, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She expects a boost in her net income and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more garments for her collection of clothing

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Jorge quien es mototaxista, fruto de ésta unión tiene 02 hermosos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente  su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Doris es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, iniciando hace 02 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, contando con un préstamo más un  capital propio fruto de sus ahorros los utilizó para iniciarse en su negocio, logrando hacerlo crecer y contar con más clientes. Al iniciar su actividad tenía problemas de un capital de respaldo, pero hizo un préstamo para poder realizar su idea de negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades  y el cuidado de su hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de venta pues no le pagaron los créditos, por eso ahora se niega a realizar este tipo de venta y todo lo vende al contado, y ve que tiene mejores resultados, por eso tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliando su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal y sus integrantes. Porque los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad al por mayor buscando los mejores precios y más bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias, además  como invertirá en  juguetes para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old and is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Jorge, who drives a moto-taxi, and they have two lovely children, ages 20 and 14, whom they love very much.  They live comfortably in their home. 

Doris sells groceries from a shop in her home, where she serves her customers; mainly her neighbors.  She started this business two years ago because she needed an additional income.  She used her own savings to start this business and was able to grow it and attract more customers.  She had problems with capital at first, but she got a loan to be able to start the business.

She likes her business because it allows her to work from home and she can count on an income.  It also allows her to use her spare time on other things and in caring for her home.  On the other hand, she doesn’t like when her customers ask for credit because she had already had bad experiences with this type of sale and people didn’t pay their debts.  Now she won’t sell this way and only accepts cash and has had better results.  She plans to continue growing and expanding her business.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support in solidifying her plans.  She also feels comfortable with the communal bank and with its members because she considers them to be responsible and united.

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy primary needs products in quantity, finding better prices so that she can increase her profit.  She will also invest in toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making snacks

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 51 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 30, 25, 15 and 8 years old. She owns a retail shop in Chepterit, which has been in operation for three years. It earns her an income of 14,000 KES monthly.

She is servicing her fifth loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully, and she intends to use this loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and oil. She will use the profit to educate her school-going children and provide for their needs.

She hopes to educate her children to greater heights.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with three children between 5 and 10 years old. He is a tea farmer and has been in business for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 70,000. 

James is servicing his first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase farm inputs and till the land in preparation for tea planting.  

The profits he earns will be used to expand his tea plantations. He hopes to be self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and till the land.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is 38 years old. She is a vigorous, married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for the past three years. She is passionate about her work, and the client demand is strong. However, business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Since a beauty parlor is needed in her area, she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Ms. Shagufta is a mother of one child. She wants to grow her business. She has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy more products such as creams, cleansers and makeup kits to meet the increasing demand. Her dream is to teach girls in her community how to apply makeup and style their hair. In this way, they can help her expand her business and earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy more products such as creams, cleansers and makeup kits for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Soninbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Soninbayar, who is 21 years old, lives with his parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment and his parents work at a train station for their employment. Recently his younger brother stays at home. 

Mr. Soninbayar has been driving his car for a taxi service for the last three years. His mother purchased the car for him through a loan. After graduating from his secondary high school, he specialized in welding. The house where they all live has very old furniture so he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy new furniture. This will enable the family to live in comfortable living conditions and give him enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy new furniture.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgarso's business is raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been doing this since he got married to Delaila. He cultivates a hectare ricefield. This business yields 15,000 PHP each harvest season. He applied for a loan of 25,000 PHP to improve his crops. He will buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide used in farming. These farm inputs will help to ensure healthier crops that he will be able to harvest abundantly. Edgardo is now 41 years old and has three children. He is also strong enough to manage his farming business. Edgardo hopes to achieve good profits for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 41, is a farmer in Nkubu county, where she lives with her husband and three children who are all in school. She has been farming for the past twelve years, producing bananas, coffee, maize, beans and milk which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell them and earn extra income that will help her uplift her living standards and pay for her children's education. She aspires to be the leading poultry products supplier in her area in the next five years.

Insufficient funds, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

Eunice believes that the funding from Juhudi kilimo will help her fight poverty.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio and his wife have been working hard in order to earn a living. The couple were blessed with two children: one is married and the other one is still reviewing for the midwifery board examination.

Rogelio has operated his livestock business for two years. Aside from livestock, he also grows corn and rice crops on his 2.5 hectares of farm land. Just recently, he sold his 22 piglets so he only has three sows left. Rogelio would like to maintain his livestock business, so he can properly care for his hogs.

Rogelio would like to take out a loan of PHP 50,000 allowing him to buy 10 bags of hog feed; some of the amount will be used for maintenance of his farming business. He hopes that he can cover all his livestock needs and farm supplies to secure proper growth of his hogs and his crops. In this way, he can earn a better income and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of hog feed and maintain his crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and married to James. She has been running a pharmacy for a period of about two years with an income of about 20,000 Kenya shillings a month. 

This is her second loan in Kadet and she wants to use it to buy more stock of medicines. She hopes to be a leading pharmacist in the town and own a hospital in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is a 40-year-old active married woman. She has been effectively doing a business of hand embroidery at her home for the last one year.  Her embroidery patterns are very famous in her town and she has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She is a loving mother of four children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. 

In order to purchase more raw materials she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls, etc., in different colors, to complete customers' orders on time. She expects more profits and hence she will be able to better support her family. She desires to spend the part of income on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ru: Жамал 51 год замужем, воспитывает 5 детей дочь и 4 сына. Жамал в качестве основного дохода занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12,000 сом. Начала она свой бизнес с приобретения одной коровы, много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жамал в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 дойная корова, 15 голов МРС, 1 лошадь, ежемесячный доход  от продажи молока и молочной продукции составляет 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Jamal is 51 years old, married, and is raising 5 children: 1 daughter and 4 sons. Jamal works in animal husbandry, which is the main source of income for the family. She started this business many years ago with a sum of only 12,000 Kyrgyzstan Som and the purchase of 1 cow. Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now includes 4 dairy cows, 15 head of smaller livestock and 1 horse, and brings in monthly earnings of 15,000 Som from the sale of milk and dairy products. For the purpose of developing her business, she has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy 2 cows. She will use the income generated by this loan to further increase the number of livestock she owns, and to save up money to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Densmaa, who is 51 years old, is a widow who lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working for an autobus service business as a conductor. Her elder son works as an autobus driver for a private transportation entity. One of her daughters works as a receptionist at a hotel. This year, her elder son began to live separately from her. 

Mrs. Densmaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy furniture for her son’s home. This will enable the home to become a comfortable living place and give them enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 36-year-old woman who has been running a home-products sales business for the last four years. She offers various products such as bed sheets, crockery and home appliances. She serves her community well; most of her clients are her neighbors. She makes enough money to contribute to the family income. 

For the expansion of her business, Ms. Bushra contacted the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase more sets of bed sheets in different colors and designs as well as packs of tea sets, dinner sets, etc. She expects a boost in her earnings through increased sales. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sets of bed sheets in different colors and designs as well as packs of tea sets, dinner sets, etc.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Rogers has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells medicine.

To help expand his business, Rogers has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs to be sold, and will help Rogers to generate greater profits and pay the family medical expenses and food. Rogers hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more businesses in town.

Rogers is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rogers who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to be sold

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo está muy contento, porque con su credikiva pasado pudo ampliar sus posibilidades de compra de chalecos, reflectores y accesorios para motociclistas. Sus ingresos se han incrementado y poco a poco puede brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija. Él envía a sus financiadores de Kiva un mensaje, donde pide lo sigan apoyando a él y en general  al sector microempresarial que lo necesita ; así mismo agradece la confianza que en él depositaron para hacerle un crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará artículos para motocicletas como cascos, chalecos, retrovisores, y sillas, que son productos muy solicitados por los clientes y necesita tener un inventario  de ellos, para aumentar sus ventas, pues rotan muy rápidamente.
texts.en: Gonzalo is very happy because he was able to increase his ability to buy vests, reflectors, and motorcycle accessories thanks to his Kiva loan.  His income has increased little by little and he is able to provide his daughter with a better quality of life.  He is sending a message to the Kiva lenders and is asking that they continue supporting him and his small business sector.  He also appreciates the trust they placed in him when giving him this loan.  He is asking for another loan that he will use to buy motorcycle accessories, such as helmets, vests, rear view mirrors, and seats.  These items are constantly sought after by his customers and he needs have a stock on hand in order to increase his sales.  They sell quickly.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 47-year-old widow with 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her husband died a few years back. Since then, she has been looking after her children and paying all household expenses alone by providing tailoring services in her community. She faced a very difficult time after the death of her husband.

Farzana works with full dedication to provide for the family's needs. She works 8 hours a day. In spite of working full time, she takes care of all the housework and makes sure that she can fulfill all of her children's needs. All of the income which comes from her tailoring business goes to the household expenses, which means she is unable to save any amount for her children's future.

Her older son owns a small gold shop but his income is insufficient; her other son is a student. One daughter is married, while the youngest helps her mother in her tailoring business.

Farzana, as a member of this 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fabric and a separate sewing machine for her daughter since currently she is having only one sewing machine which is used by both of them. Therfore purchasing a new sewing machine will help them to save time and stitch up more dresses in less time. This will also help them to satisfy the needs of clients more professionally and efficiently which will gradually increase their net income and savings as well. Farzana hopes that the loan will be beneficial to them.

Note: In the picture Farzana holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ronah

texts.en:
Ronah is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Ronah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Ronah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clothes for sale, and will help Ronah to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself and pay her medical bills. Ronah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big restaurant in town.

Ronah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 38 years old and supports six family members. For the past four years, he has been distributing bread and he earns approximately 18,000 KES each month. 

Joshua is requesting his fifth loan from KADET LTD to buy bread to distribute during the high season. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy bread to distribute

loans.name: Ahimu

texts.en:
Ahimu is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ibanba in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Ahimu has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Ahimu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Ahimu to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ahimu hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up other more retail shops around town. 

Ahimu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahimu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, William has been working hard to manage his small bar, which sells drinks. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as lemonade, wine, and beer for resale, and will help William to generate greater profits and pay medical bills for his children and school  fees. William hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business into a depot. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as lemonade, wine and beer for resale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past five years, Jeanne has been working hard to manage her small business, which hires out music systems. 

To help expand her business, Jeanne has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more music systems that will be hired out for ceremonies, and will help Jeanne to generate greater profits and pay for family medical expenses and food. Jeanne hopes that in the future she will be able to open up other similar businesses in town. 

Jeanne is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jeanne who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more music systems that will be hired out for ceremonies

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children. For the past 25 years, she has run a business manufacturing "waan," a thread-like material that is used to make bed and mattress frames. Kousar makes a variety of waans in different colors and she is famous for providing good quality products in her community. Kouser works hard to fulfill her family's needs and improve her family's finances. She supports her husband to provide a better future for her children. Kousar has been associating with the Kashf Foundation for the past five years and has an excellent repayment history.

Kousar is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to purchase another machine to make waan with good quality thread. Her loan will increase her sales and earnings so she can better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to make bed and mattress frames and increase her sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria cooks and sells food for snacks and meals to the people in her area. She is 38 years old and has three children, whom she is sending to school. She would like to keep serving and offering her customers delicious meals. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy vegetables, meat and rice, to cook and sell. These goods would let her cook a variety of delicious viands. She hopes that her business will actively grow as she continues to offer unique recipes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and rice, to cook and sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 27 years old and still single. For the past 10 years, he has owned and operated a butcher shop. George earns about 12,000 KES shillings a month.

George is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD to buy more meat to meet customer demand. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. In the future, George hopes to be a leading beef supplier in the area.

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. For the past 10 years, she has been farming seaweed with her husband. This is the source of her income.

Aida is requesting a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope. Her loan will enable her to improve her seaweed farming business and increase her harvest and profit. In the future, Aida hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 42-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She runs a hand-embroidery business using cloth from last year. Farzana's designs are very popular in her area and she has a good client list. Her husband is an old man who is not able to earn enough to meet the house expenses and Farzana earns enough to lead a decent life. 

Farzana is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan with the Kashf Foundation to purchase spools of thread, cloth, packages of needles, pearls, and sequins. Her loan will help her to meet her increasing demand. Farzana expects a boost in her net income and hopes to spend part of her profits on her daughters' marriage ceremonies.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, cloth, packages of needles, pearls, and sequins

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 41-year-old father of three children married to Alice, who is also a farmer in Nyahururu town. He does dairy farming as well as plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes.

Having paid his previous loan amount well and in good time, this will be his third loan term. He plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer and seeds for planting. He also plans to buy dairy feeds for his dairy cows.

Peter hopes to grow on a larger scale and plant more cash crops as well as make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of soaps and detergents for sale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 53-year-old fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol in the Philippines. She has been in the fish vending business for more than 16 years.

Antonia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in her place. With this loan, she will be able to cater to and sell more fish to the people in her locality. In the future, Antonia dreams of expanding her business and making it successful.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to the people in her place.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 26 years old and married to Charity. He supports his family and pays school fees for his younger brothers. He has been selling electronics goods for one year, with an income of about 71,000 KES (Kenya shillings) per month. He also owns a barber shop.

Jeremiah is taking a second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He wants to use this loan to buy more electronic items for resale. He hopes to improve his family's living standards and to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy electrical items for resale.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr: Femme dynamique de 49ans, Latifa est revendeuse de céréales dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Elle l’exerce depuis 1992 et achète à Lomé et dans les villes intérieures du pays.
