Simón, es casado y tiene un hijo vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe, el piso de tierra y las paredes semi planchadas con estuco y tumbado de contención, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

Simón estudió solo hasta el bachillerato y actualmente trabaja como chofer en el área del transporte publico sindicalizado por más de ocho horas al día y con una antigüedad de 3 años, su esposa dio a luz un bebé hace 5 meses y no trabaja por el momento; de esta forma Simón  cubre los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y gastos médicos de su familia ya que no cuentan con seguro medico.

El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su movilidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos; los gastos de mantenimiento y mano de obra son muy elevados es por eso que requieren este servicio.

El sueño de Simón, es vivir en casa anticrético para mejorar su calidad de vida y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Simón is married and has a son; he lives in a one-bedroom, rented house with adobe walls and dirt floor; the walls are semi-plastered with stucco and are wire-mesh reinforced.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.

Simón studied up to high-school and currently works as a driver providing syndicated public transportation services for more than 8 hours daily; he has three years’ experience.   His wife had a baby five months ago and isn’t working for now.  Simón therefore covers all food, clothing and medical expenses for his family since they have no medical insurance.

He needs the loan to service his vehicle which is his only source of income.  Service and labor costs are quite high which is why he needs this service.  Simón’s dream is to live in a house in the ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality to improve his quality of life and provide more comfort for his family.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay maintenance costs for his transportation vehicle

loans.name: Narmeen

texts.en:
Narmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Narmeen is a 29-year-old young married woman. She is the mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the necessary needs for the family. Now Narmeen's husband is studying for a Masters degree in arts and he is very interested in completing his education.

Narmeen took a 1500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover completing the masters degree costs. This will ensure a better future for Narmeen's husband and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay the university fees

loans.name: Julissa Mercedes

texts.es: La joven Julissa de 23 años es casada tiene un hijo de 5 años a quien tienen en un colegio internado y cuando ella sale del trabaja lo pasa llevando, su esposo labora como taxista, juntos salen adelante con su pequeña familia, Julissa estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria no pudo terminar sus estudios por la situación económica, trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular, las dificultades que ha tenido es el no tener el apoyo de su familia materna y paterna ya que viven lejos de Managua, ella solicita este primer crédito para terminar de hacer la pared del patio de su casa y para eso necesita comprar cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y pagar la mano de obra, agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar a travez de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Young Julissa, 23, is married and has a 5-year-old son attending boarding school and when she gets off work she drops him off; her husband works as a taxi driver and together they move forward with their small family.  Julissa studied up to third year of secondary school; she was unable to complete her schooling because of the economic situation.  She works in a private home as a domestic employee.  She’s had the difficulty of not having support from either her paternal or maternal families because they live far from Managua.  She’s requesting her first loan to finish building her house’s patio wall.  To do so, she needs to buy cement, sand, blocks, rebar and to pay labor costs.  She’s grateful for the help she might get through Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en:
Isabelito is a coconut shell buyer from Trinidad, Bohol. Coconut shells are valued as firewood and for making charcoal.

Isabelito needs additional capital for his business. He is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells.

In the future, Isabelito wants to expand his business and explore another venture to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, con la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y patos) y con la agricultura donde siembra diferentes vegetales (culantro, perejil, orégano, papa, maíz y otros). Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank, with raising small animals (guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and ducks) and with agriculture growing different vegetables (coriander, parsley, oregano, potatoes, corn and others).  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  She requests the loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs.  She’s a responsible, kind woman who supports her family and is happy with this loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Elías quien es artesano y el padre de sus 2 hijos: Medita de 34 años de edad y Jhon de 19 años de edad, ambos acompañados de sus respectivas familias, compartiendo los gastos del hogar. Habitan juntos una su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Martina es la venta de artesanías nativas como colares, pulseras, aretes, mantas, y otros para eso cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa donde prepara todas sus artesanías con el apoyo de sus hijos. Luego realiza la venta de manera ambulatoria por las plazas y centros turísticos de la ciudad atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son turistas  y que ellos la recomienden con otras personas que luego son sus clientes. 
Tiene más de 15 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su familia, aprendiendo de su madre y ahora ella enseñando  a sus hijos.
Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y le permite sentirse ocupada contando con un oficio. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, buscando generarse más ingresos económicos.
Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de materiales como telas de tocuyo para la confección de mantas con detalles nativos, así como accesorios y artesanías nativas, para tener un stock surtido y disponible para la venta buscando precios más bajos por su compra en volumen.
texts.en:
Martina, 48, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being kind and gracious.  Her spouse is Elías who is a craftsman and father of their two children, Medita, 34 and Jhon, 19, both with spouses and their respective families and sharing household expenses.  They all live together in their own house.

Martina’s activity is selling native crafts like necklaces, bracelets, earrings, blankets and others.  To do so, she has a small workshop at home where she makes all the crafts with help from her children.  She then sells them from place to place in squares and tourist sites in the city providing very gracious customer service who for the most part are tourists and other people referred to her by them who also become her customers.

She’s been in this business for 15 years and to date does it with support from her family; she learned from her mother and now she’s teaching her children.  She considers the business to be profitable because of the high demand it has and the profits it yields.

She likes her business because it generates income and allows her to stay busy and to have an occupation.  Therefore, she plans to continue with the business and to make it grow hoping to generate higher income.

This will be MFP loan #5 so she’s hoping for your collaboration in order to reach her objectives.  On the other hand, she likes the work the communal bank has been doing supporting people so they can advance with their businesses. 

She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy supplies like ‘tocuyo’ [coarse cotton cloth] to make blankets with native designs as well as accessories and indigenous crafts in order to have a good variety of stock for sale looking for lower prices so she can buy in volume.

loans.use: to buy fabric, accessories and indigenous crafts.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una empresa privada de marketing,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este trabajo,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar una computadora para su casa.

El socio  se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member continues to work for a private marketing company, where he works from 8:00 A.M. until 7:00 P.M. He has been working at this job for 7 years, and his dream is to run a small grocery store. He is asking for a loan to buy a computer for home use.

This member very much appreciates the opportunity that is being provided to him by this organization, and he is committed to paying back the loan in full according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a computer for home use.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 39, lives in the Sinkor community. She is the mother of five children who are between the ages of 9 and 22 and attend school. 

Mamie has been hard-working with her business for the past five years. She sells children's clothes of both boys and girls. Mamie started with the small amount of  $6000 LRD that was given to her by her husband. She learned to sell from her husband since he is a business man. She sells twelve hours a day. 

Mamie has commended the lenders for their support in her business; they have empowered her to improve her business. She makes a profit when she sells and she uses the profit to buy more goods to increase her income.  

She has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her future plan is to give her children a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is an ambitious young man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When he was unable to further his education due to lack of school fees, he decided to set up a bar with his savings earned from cocoa growing, an activity he still practices. He says inadequate capital and high license fees hinder his business.

Benard is requesting this loan to buy beer and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season when demand is especially high. His goals are to educate his children up to the University and own a modern bar.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mehrafruz

texts.ru: Мехрафрузу 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 18 и 14 лет. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации, а она сама уже 18 лет работает учительницей младших классов в средней школе. Она является одной из успешных работников. У нее очень хорошие и умные дети. Ее старшая дочь учится на 1 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета. Зарплата Мехрафруза и отправленные деньги ее мужа не хватает оплатить за учебы дочери. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы дочери в университете. Мехрафруз и ее дочь ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mehrafruz is 40 years old.  She is married and raising two children, who are 18 and 14 years old.  Her husband is migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and she has been working as a primary grades teacher at a secondary school for 18 years.  She is one of the successful workers.  Mehrafruz has good and smart children.  Her oldest daughter is a first-year student at the Tajikistan State University.  Mehrafruz's salary and money that her husband sends are not enough to pay for their daughter's education.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her daughter's education at the university.  Mehrafruz and her daughter await your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education at the university

loans.name: Finah

texts.en:
Thanks to a prior Kiva loan, Finah has experienced a significant growth in the size and quality of her business. She was able to add more stock. which led to an increase in sales and profit. Finah uses the extra profit she makes to pay school fees for her child, feed herself and family, and repay the loan. 

Having paid the loan successfully, Finah is requesting a new loan for 5,000,000 Leones, which she will use to further expand her business by buying  more cosmetics to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as body lotions, sprays, and soaps.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married and has five children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  Aisha has been selling second-hand clothes in the market at retail for 10 years, working seven days a week. She also sells bananas as a side job.

Aisha is requesting a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 300,000 UGX, which she will use to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to buy more bales of clothes and also become a wholesaler.  She joined MCDT because of transparency. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying rent and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Thank God

texts.fr: Thank God est un homme âgé de 44 ans qui mène une activité de confection depuis 15 ans déjà. sa longue expérience dans la domaine lui a permit de se constituer un portefeuille clientèle considérable. Il coud sur commande et ensuite les livres en gros auprès des détaillants. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des rouleaux de tissus et le matériel de couture pour renforcer sa capacité productive afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. les revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Thank God is a 44-year old man who has been working as a tailor for 15 years. His long experience in the field has allowed him to build a considerable customer base. He sews on order and delivers his items wholesale to retailers. With this loan, he would like to buy bolts of fabric and sewing supplies in order to bolster his production capacity and better meet customer demand. His revenues will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, 28 years old and living in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda, is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Johnson has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells plastic items.

To help expand his business, Johnson has requested a loan of 2500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more plastic buckets, plates, etc. to resell. This will help Johnson generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future he hopes to open up a wholesale shop.

Johnson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Johnson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic buckets, plates, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru is 25 years old and single.  He is a businessman in the township of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Umaru sells cigarettes, batteries, books, pens, biscuits, etc., which he has been doing for many years. 

Umaru is requesting a loan, which he will use to expand on the size and quality of her business by buying cigarettes, batteries, books, pens, biscuits, etc. in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, batteries, books, pens, and biscuits.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: Shadia is 52 years old and has six children; one of them is a university student majoring in accounting. She is requesting a loan to support her daughter so she can graduate with an accounting degree. She asked her son to take her place in the photo

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ededrones y mascaras,la socia vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de su trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender articulos de fiesta de cumpleaños.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ededrones.

La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y se compromete a realizar los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo
texts.en:
The borrower is continuing to sell comforters and masks. She sells independently and works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. By means of her work, she is raising her children. She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell ítems for birthday parties. She is requesting a loan to buy comforters.

The borrower is a very hard-working woman, and promises to make the necessary installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy comforters.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad is a 40-year-old housewife. After her husband retired he started working in another job to be able to support their three sons and two daughters. Suad also started a small home-based business buying and selling birds and pigeons. Now she has applied for this loan to buy more pigeons and more bird food to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more pigeons and more bird food

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

 
She has been selling charcoal in a shop for ten years and works seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

Eseza has requested a loan of UShs 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to start selling green bananas as well. She joined MCDT because of low loan interest. She lives in her house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Teresa, de 39  años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Juliano quien es agricultor y padre de sus 5 hijos: Itler de 18, Antoni de 15, Beker de 12, Andrés de 9 y Jefferson de 5 años de edad.  Juntos viven en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Teresa es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que instaló en su casa ubicada en una comunidad nativa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son su vecinos y ha sabido ganarse sus preferencias por el buen trato que les brinda.
Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo ocasional de su pareja. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son de primera necesidad y que tiene salida a diario, dando una rotación constante a su capital.
Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos y apoyara a su padres con los gastos del hogar. 
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio y retomar la preparación y venta de artesanías nativas. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal por el apoyo y la solidaridad que siente en sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para llevar a su comunidad nativa y surtir su negocio, así tener un stock variado disponible para la  venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa, 39, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being kind and gracious who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Juliano who works in agriculture and father of their five children: Itler, 18, Antoni, 15, Beker, 12, Andrés, 9 and Jefferson, 5.  They all live together in a house of their own.

The activity that Teresa does is selling basic staple grocery items in a store she set up at home located in an indigenous community where she provides very kind customer service who for the most part are her neighbors and who she’s won over through the good service she provides.

She started more than 10 years ago with some capital of her own and to date continues with occasional support from her spouse.  She considers the business to be quite profitable because her products are of basic need and are sold daily which keeps her capital in constant rotation.  Before starting her business she didn’t have any problems but she did want to generate her own income and help her parents with household expenses.

Seeing the good results she’s getting, then, she wants to continue in business and restart selling native crafts.  This will be MFP loan #4.  She’s happy to be able to count on financial support to advance in her business.  She also feels comfortable in her communal bank because of the support and solidarity she feels among the members.  She will use the requested 1,200 new soles to buy grocery items in general to take to her indigenous community and stock her store so that she will have a varied stock available for sale looking for the lowest prices for volume purchases so that she can earn higher profits this way.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items at wholesale.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Человек, который посвятил всю свою жизнь в воспитании и образовании детей своего района, нуждается вашей поддержки. Его зовут Ахрор. Ему 55 лет, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Его дети выросли, и он должен женить и выдать замуж. Так как его жена Чинигул домохозяйка, он единственный кормилец в семье. Он старается из-за всех сил обеспечить семью хорошим условием жизни и поэтому дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия одного из детей. Он надеется только на вас и обещает погасить займ во время. Этот займ поможет осуществить мечту его сына, то есть жениться на любимой. Давайте вместе поможем, таким добрым людям для осуществления их долгожданной мечты!
texts.en: The person, who devoted all of his life to raising and educating the children of his district, needs your support.  His name is Ahror.  He is 55 years old, married and has five children.  His children have grown up, and he has to marry them off.  Because his wife, Chinigul, is a homemaker, Ahror is the sole provider for the family.  He uses all of his efforts to provide his family with good living conditions and this is why he is additionally involved in animal husbandry.  Ahror is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to hold a wedding for one of his children.  He relies only on you and promises to repay the loan on-time.  This loan will help his son's dream come true, which is to marry his beloved.  Let's help these kind people together to make their long-awaited dream come true!

loans.use: to hold a wedding for one of his children

loans.name: Umedakhon

texts.ru: Умедахону 32 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 3 лет она работает в библиотеке библиотекарем. Она любит свою работу, то есть дать и рекомендовать читателям полезные книги. Она очень уважает начитанных людей. Зарплата Умедахона не хватает для нормального проживания и поэтому она хочет организовать новый бизнес скотоводством, так как климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. У нее большой огород, где она может выращивать сено для скота. Она хочет продавать молоко своим соседям. Она хочет организовать и развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umedakhon is 32 years old, married and raising four children.  She has been working as a librarian at a library for over three years.  She loves her work of providing and recommending useful books to readers.  She respects well-read people very much.  Umedakhon's salary is not enough for normal living and this is why she wants to start a new business in animal husbandry, especially because her local climate is quite suitable for growing agricultural crops and for animal husbandry.  She has a large garden, where she can grow hay for livestock.  She wants to sell milk to her neighbors.  She wants to organize and develop her business, but does not have enough financial means for this.  Umedakhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy livestock.  She plans to use the resulting income to provide her children with a good education and current technology.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start her own business

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель Яванского района. Он женатый молодой человек. Ему 29 лет. Он является отцом двоих детей. Хуршед на сегодняшний день ничем не занимается. Он берет кредит для ремонта собственной автомашины, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Он намерен предоставлять услугу по маршруту Душанбе - Яван.
texts.en: Khurshed is a resident of the Yavan region. He is a young, married man of 29, and a father of two children. At the current moment, Khurshed is unemployed.  He is taking this loan to repair his personal vehicle so that he can start his own transportation business. He plans to provide service between Dushanbe and Yavan.

loans.use: to repair his personal vehicle so that he can start his own transportation business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa, a 21-year-old single lady living with her six younger siblings, recently started a small home business as an additional source of family income and to support herself. She started by buying kitchen appliances at wholesale prices to resell to neighbors and friends.

Alaa, who is depending on word of mouth to promote her new business, has requested this youth loan to purchase more kitchen appliances as well as other home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchen and other home appliances.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab, a 46-year-old mother of two children who is married to Joseph, is a tailor in Nyahururu town. She has been in the business for four years and it has been profitable.

This will be her second loan, and she plans to use it to buy more sewing materials to use in her business. Since there are usually many demands from her clients during the December festive season, she anticipates more profits, with which she plans to buy more materials both to use and to sell to various tailors in other places.

She hopes to expand her business by opening another tailoring shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Akmalshoh

texts.ru: Акмалшох проживает в районе Яван. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. Акмалшох имеет среднее образование. Он хочет заняться своим бизнесом. Акмалшох взял в аренду помещение, где намерен открыть продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для приобретения продуктов питания, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Akmalshoh lives in the Yavan region. He is 27 years old and married. Akmalshoh has high school education. He would like to have his own business. 

Akmalshoh has rented premises where he plans to open a grocery store. He takes a loan for the purchase of food products in order to start up his business.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to start up a business

loans.name: Josyline

texts.en:
Josyline is 32 years old.  She owns a grocery store where she supplies bananas. She used her previous loan to add to her stock of bananas. Her business did well and she successfully repaid her loan. 

Josyline is requesting a loan for 53,156 KES, which she will use to add stocks of bananas. She hopes to own a vehicle and have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

loans.name: Bubuya

texts.ru: Бубуя 55 лет, вдова, воспитала 2 детей, младшей дочери 15 лет учится в школе. Бубуя в качестве основного дохода с 1992 году занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуя в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 10 дойная корова с приплодом,8 голов быков, 5 лошадей. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 25,000 сом от продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубуя обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бубуя планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины в целях увеличения выручки от молока, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Bubuya is 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children, the younger of which is a 15-year-old daughter studying in school. 

As a main source of income, Bubuya has been engaged in raising animals since 1992, starting this business with 1,000 KGS. Through hard work, Bubuya today has in her homestead ten dairy cows with offspring, eight heads of bull, and five horses. Monthly income from the business is 25,000 Som from mile sales. 

In order to further develop her business, Bubuya appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy livestock. Bubuya plans to invest income from the loan to further increase her number of domestic animals in order to increase revenue from milk and to save enough money to repair her home.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Фотиме 47 лет. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. В ее районе все уважают и знают ее как добросовестную женщину. Судьба у этой прекрасной женщины очень трудная, ее заботливый и любимый муж умер, и она осталась вдовой с 2 детьми. Ей было очень трудно после смерти мужа с обеспечением детей, на все не хватило денег. Дети выросли, у нее невестки и внуки, но все еще она должна обеспечивать семью в основном сама, так как ее сыновья мало зарабатывают. У нее очень богатый опыт в скотоводстве и она собирается организовать собственный бизнес скотоводством.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Ее невестки будут помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она будет продавать молоко и другие переработанные молочные продукты, как кефир и сметану. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить свою семью хорошим условием проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10500 сомони для покупки коров, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotima is 47 years old.  She is a very kind and hardworking woman.  In her neighborhood everyone respects her and knows her as an honest woman.  This wonderful woman has a very difficult fate, her caring and beloved husband died and she was left a widow with 2 children.  She had a very hard time after her husband's death providing for her children, she did not have enough money for everything.  The children grew up, she has daughters in law and grandchildren, but she still has to support the family mostly alone, because her sons earn little.  She has a lot of experience raising livestock and she plans to start her own livestock business.

With this goal she took a course "Get Ahead" organized by the Businesswomen's Association and earned a certificate.  Now she can start her own business and become successful in this sphere.  Her daughters in law will help her to run the business.  She will sell milk and other processed dairy products such as kefir and sour cream.  She plans to use the earnings to provide her family with good living conditions.  She is asking for a loan of 10,500 somoni to buy cows to start her business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows for new business

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is 51 years old and a housewife who is looking after her two sons and one daughter whose ages are 28, 22, and 15 years old. Iman has a home business selling blankets and bed covers to supplement the family income. She has applied for this loan in order to increase her stock of bed covers to be able to cover the winter demand.

loans.use: to increase her stock of bed covers

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is 44 years old and mother to eight sons and daughters, two of whom are married. Hala’s husband is a driver; with the income from this he is supporting the family. On the other hand, Hala brings big amounts of dates and other fruits, to make various kinds of homemade jam. She has applied for this loan in order to get more jam containers in different sizes. Using the new containers will enable her to sell jams to some food markets in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to get more jars in various sizes, to use for her homemade jams.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is now 25 years old, married and has one child. He used his previous loan to buy fruits for his store. His fruit business did well and he successfully repaid his loan. He has been selling fruits for the past ten years and is very hardworking. From the time he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business properly.

He hopes to get employed in the future and also and have his own premises of selling fruits. He needs a loan of 105,300 KES to buy fruits for his store.

loans.use: to buy fruit for his store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
"Ali is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Ali has been working hard to manage his small bakery where he makes bread, cookies, and doughnuts for resale. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 2500000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour and cooking oil for making bread and will help Ali to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to own another bakery in town. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ali, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more flour and cooking oil for making bread

loans.name: Fata

texts.en:
Fata, 38, lives in the Sinkor community with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 6 and 18, and are attending school. For the past ten years she has been selling coal, palm oil, rice, pepper, onions, and many other items at retail prices. 

Some difficulties she faces are the low sales during the raining season. She makes a profit when she sells, and she uses the profit to buy more goods for resale, and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells for eleven hours a day, and she transports her goods by taxi. She thanks the lenders for empowering her in her business. With the loan she receives, she will purchase more coal, palm oil, rice, pepper, and onions for her business. She hopes to build a decent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, palm oil, rice, pepper, and onions for her business,

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,la socia realiza trabajos de bordados,ella hace trabajos como mantas y sueteres,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y luegos los vende en las tiendas,la socia ya tiene 6 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lana,hilos y palitos de tejedores.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still working in her handicraft business. She does embroidery work and makes shawls and sweaters. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm, and then sells her crafts in the stores. 

She has been doing this for six years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her handicrafts business. 

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy wool, thread and knitting needles.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy wool, thread and knitting needles.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 58 years old, married, and has seven children.  He is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town, which he has been doing for seven years. He rears livestock as well as plants cash crops such as maize, beans, potatoes, and vegetables. His wife is also a farmer.

Simon is requesting his first loan for 10,000 KES, which he will use to buy two sheep for rearing. His livestock will later be sold at a profit to butchery traders. He will use the generated income to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. In the future, Simon hopes to expand his farming business by planting large scale.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep.

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es: Doña Magda mujer trabajadora con muchos esfuerzo y sacrificio ha sacado adelante a sus hijos quienes están estudiando la educación superior, ella les ayuda con los gastos universitarios con su esposo unen fuerzas él trabaja en un negocio de tragamonedas, Magda siempre continua vendiendo cosméticos por el cual solicita su crédito número 6 con Afodenic, apoyo que necesita para comprar más productos, para seguir vendiendo más aun en esta temporada navideña que las ventas son muy buenas, desea invertir de vanidades, perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo, todos para damas y caballeros, con las ganancias apoyara a su familia, está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva y Afodenic siempre que ella lo necesita lo cual es muy necesario para su desarrollo económico.
texts.en: Magda is a hard-working woman who, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, has advanced her children. They are now studying at university. She is helping them with university expenses. She is joining forces with her husband. He works in a slot-machine business. She continues to sell cosmetics, which is why she is applying for loan number six with Afodenic. This is support that she needs to buy more products, to keep selling more even in this Christmas season, when sales are very good. She wants to invest in vanities, perfumes, body creams, and shampoos, all for men and women. She will support her family with her earnings. She is very thankful for the help that Kiva and Afodenic give her whenever she needs it. It is very important for her economic development.

loans.use: to buy vanities, perfumes, body creams, and shampoo for men and women.

loans.name: Marlit

texts.es:
La Señora Marlit de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo,  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, posee casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02  años al negocio ambulante de venta de ropa, sus clientes son  vecinos y  personas aledañas a su comunidad y amigos que ella visita a diario, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Marlit está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, calzado, camisas, blusas y lociones que son los productos que ella vende.
Doña Marlit espera que el préstamo le genere ganancias que le ayudan a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma. 
Doña Marlit su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa y crecer su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Marlit is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two dependent children. She has her own house. She has been spending the past 2 years selling clothes door-to-door. Her clients are neighbors and people who live in the surrounding communities, as well as friends who visit her daily. She lives in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. Marlit is requesting a loan to purchase trousers, skirts, dresses, shoes, shirts, blouses and lotions - which are the products she sells. Marlit hopes that the loan will allow her to generate income that will help her improve her quality of life as well as her family's. She is very happy to be working with Prisma. Marlit's dream is to continue to improve her home and grow her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, skirts, dresses, shoes, shirts, blouses and lotions for her business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира 27 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) 18 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Гульмира смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошади и 5 голов овец и один трактор. Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства,Гульмира оплачивает затраты на основные нужды семьи. Гульмира продает с дома молоко и молочную продукцию и овощи в лето-осенний период. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дополнительных голов скота. Что позволит увеличить сбор молока и соответственно доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 27 years old, married and has 5 children. As a main income for the family, Gulnara works with livestock breeding and crop planting. After having started this business 18 years ago with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS), Gulmira has been able to develop her business thanks to persistent work. The monthly income is in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today the farm counts 2 cows, 1 horse, 5 sheep and one tractor. Thanks to the income from the business, Gulmira is able to pay for the family's basic needs. Gulmira sells milk and dairy products from her home, as well as vegetables in the spring and fall. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulmira turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. This will increase the amount of milk and accordingly the family's income. Gulmira plans to invest the income in further developing her business, and in the future would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 43 года, замужем, имеет 6 детей.Все дети и муж  помогают Анар по хозяйству. Анар в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS) 12 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Анар смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 4,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 2 лошади и 22 голов овец и 3 теленка. Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства, Анар оплачивает затраты на основные нужды семьи. Анар продает с дома молоко и молочную продукцию. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупки телят и ягнят. Что позволит в будущем увеличить сбор молока и соответственно доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет осуществить свою давнюю мечту, сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Anar is 43 years old, married, and has six children. All the children and her husband help Anar with her business. Anar works with livestock breeding, which is their main source of income. 

After having started this business 12 years ago with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS), Anar has been able to develop her farm through persistent work. The monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). Today the farm has 3 cows, 2 horses, 22 sheep and 3 calves. Thanks to the income from the farm, Anar can pay for the family's needs. Anar sells milk and dairy products from her home. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Anar turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves and lambs. This will in the future increase the amount of milk and therefore the family income. Anar plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and in the future would like to fulfill her dream of repairing their house.

loans.use: to purchase calves and lambs

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.ru: Асадулло 25 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая нигде не работает и является хорошей домохозяйкой. Они еще не имеют детей и мечтают, чтобы их будущие дети стали образованными и хорошими людьми, чтобы они гордились своими детьми. Асадулло несколько лет работает в Отделе Внутренних Дел милиционером. Он хочет карьерного роста и дальнейшего развития. У него много планов, однако, его знания и степень образования не дают возможность для этого. Он в этом году поступил в университет по своей специальности для усовершенствования своих знаний. Его зарплата не хватает для оплаты в университете. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает оплатить займ во время.
texts.en: Asadullo is 25 years old.  He is married to a wonderful woman who does not work and is a good homemaker.  They do not have children yet and their dream is that their future children become educated and good people, so that they can be proud of their children.  Asadullo has been working as a policeman in the Department of Internal Affairs for several years.  He would like to grow his career and continue his development.  He has many plans, but alas his knowledge and education level do not give him the opportunity for this.  This year he entered university in his specialty and to improve his knowledge.  His salary is not enough to pay for university.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to pay for university studies.  He is waiting for your kindness and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Tabassum

texts.ru:
Табассуму 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет  с родителями. Ее родители гордятся, что у них такая красивая и умная дочь. Табассум очень трудолюбивая. Она полна энергий и новых идей и всегда старается мотивировать свои идеи. Она хочет стать молодой бизнес леди и достигать успехов в этой сфере.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем вышивки в национальных женских платьях. У нее богатая фантазия  и она вполне может развевать свой бизнес с творческим подходом. От полученного дохода она планирует помочь родителям для улучшения условия проживания, а также создать свой собственный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tabassum is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents are proud that they have such a beautiful and clever daughter. Tabassum is very hardworking. She is full of energy and new ideas, and always tries to follow through her ideas. She wants to become a young business lady and to achieve success in this field. 

To that end, she took the "Bring It On" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate. 

Now she may well start her own business and become successful in this field. She wants to organize a business sewing embroidery on national dresses. She has a rich imagination and she may well develop her business with a creative approach. She plans to use the revenue to help her parents improve their living conditions, as well as to create her own source of capital. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine to establish an new business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for organizing new business

loans.name: Aitbu

texts.ru: Айтбу 35 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Айтбу в качестве основного дохода с 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 KGS сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айтбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Айтбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и на следующий год планирует купить автотранспорт.
texts.en:
Aitbu is 35 years old, married, and has three children. As a main source of income, Aitbu has been engaging in raising animals since 1997, starting this business with 10,000 KGS Som. Through hard work, Aitbu today has a very developed farm. 

In order to further develop her business, Aitbu appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 Som (KGS) to purchase livestock: young animals for fattening and resale. 

Aitbu plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of domestic animals, and in the next year plans to buy an automobile.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia 31, stopped her education in the 12th grade. She is a hard-working mother with four children, between the ages of 3 months and 13 years. Three of the children attend school, while the other child is still a baby.

 Lydia has a warehouse where she sells charcoal. She has been operating this business for the past nine years. She resides  with her husband at Sinkor. Her husband is an artist, and he gave her the initial capital to start in this business. She sells twelve hours a day. 

Lydia transports her goods from the bush to Monrovia by truck. She appreciates the lenders for their support in her business. She is requesting a Loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for the business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for the business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David runs a tailoring business in Nyahururu town and has been in the business for the past 12 years. He is 58 years of age and married to Rebekah, and they have child who is 10 years old.

This is his first loan and he plans to use this loan amount to buy more materials for sewing. He will also sell some of the materials, especially fabric materials, to his tailoring traders and customers. Being a festive season, this will enable him to meet the high demands of his customers as well as satisfy their needs and make more profit.

He hopes to expand his business by opening another tailoring business in Nyahururu town.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sewing, e.g. thread, needles, and some fabric materials.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, 32, is married and has two sons and two daughters. Mohammad owns and works in an equipment repairing shop. He also sells used equipment, after he fixes them in his shop if they need repairing. Now, Mohammad wants to enhance his shop by making a new storefront for it. He will use this loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to make a new storefront for his shop, where he repairs equipment and sells used equipment.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel does a motorcycle transport business in Olkalau town and has been in business for four years. He is 30 years old, married to Ruth, and they have two children. Besides the motorcycle business, he also sells timber to various construction sites.

This is his fourth loan; he plans to buy timber for resale to various timber yards as well as carpenters. He anticipates making more profits which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to buy a big farm and plant trees for timber processing.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Asuwa

texts.en:
Asuwa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Asuwa has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which makes and sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Asuwa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to resell, which will help Asuwa to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Asuwa hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop that sells clothes in town. 

Asuwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asuwa, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her small clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for selling, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a hospital of her own. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Allah Walie Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Allah Walie” group. They are small scale businessmen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age 50; he was born in Kabala town where he is currently residing together with his wife and 6 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mohamed has been a businessman for 12 years now; he combines both commercial motor driving and the selling of local produces like rice, pepper, groundnuts, etc. With the help of this loan Mohamed is going to buy rice, pepper, ground nuts, etc., in bulk, to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, ground nuts, etc., in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Anne has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells electrical wires. 

To help expand her business, Anne has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy electronic wires for resale, and will help Anne to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Anne hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into wholesale shop. 

Anne is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anne who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy electronic wires for resale.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 46 years old and lives in Urut village of Lori region with her husband and son. Naira is involved in agriculture, breeding cattle, and selling milk and milk products as well as providing beef to local butchers. Naira’s husband is a forester and earns a monthly income but it is insufficient to cover the family's everyday expenses. So, Naira has applied for this loan to purchase a milk cow and three cattle. This will help her to expand her agricultural business. Milk products are considered very healthy and common in everyday life.  
The loan will help Naira to earn more income and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and three cattle.

loans.name: Yanush

texts.en: Yanush is 37 years old and lives in Tegh village of Syuniq region with his wife, mother and four children. Yanush breeds cattle and keeps 90 lambs, 20 chickens and five cows. He sells milk and milk products as well as provides beef to local butchers. Yanush has 17 years of experience in this field thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle. Selling milk and milk products to local markets helps Yanush earn a monthly income. But unfortunately, it is not enough to cover his big family’s everyday costs. So, Yanush has applied for this loan. With the loan proceeds, he would purchase 25 lambs. He will raise and fatten them for five to six months and resell them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  This will significantly increase Yanush’s income and will enable him to ensure a better future for his four children.

loans.use: to purchase 25 lambs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, con la crianza de animales menores (cuyes y gallinas) y con la elaboración de chicha de jora, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with Virgen Concebida de Arin Communal Bank, raising small animals (guinea pigs and chickens) and making "chicha de jora" [corn liquor].  She also makes a living selling staple items such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other things.  She has been in this business for several years now and it's going very well for her.

She's requesting the loan to buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other things.

She's a responsible and kind person who gets her family ahead.  She's happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other things

loans.name: La Acienda De Comitancillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Crisanta esta casada, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó solamente un año la educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio este negocio comprando pollos de engorde y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de gallina ponedoras, y de esta forma mejorar su trabajo, ya que espera tener una granja de pollos para poder vender huevos en el futuro. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a  la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Crisanta, 41, is married and has one child who attends school.  She only had one year of elementary school.  She makes a living raising domestic animals.  She started this business buying chickens to fatten and at the moment has 10 years of experience raising animals.  She has the help of her husband, who's a day laborer.

She's organizing a group to request a loan to buy laying hens.  This way she'll improve her job, because she hopes to have a chicken farm so she can sell eggs in the future.

The other members work as merchants and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy laying hens

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is 58 years old. He lives in Arevadasht village, of Armavir region, with his wife, daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have 40 colonies of bees and several cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Additionally, Artashes owns agricultural land, where he grows peach, apple and pear trees. He sells the harvested fruits locally, in an open market, at good prices. Artashes is a very hard-working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. 
 
Artashes has requested a loan for purchasing 10 colonies of bees and 5 cows. This will help him increase his family's income and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 colonies of bees and 5 cows.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is 44 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Abubakar has been working hard to manage his small shop, where he sells shoes. 

To help expand his business, Abubakar has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fashionable shoes for reselling. This will help Abubakar to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Abubakar hopes that in the future he will be able to become the richest man in town. 

Abubakar is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abubakar, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable shoes, to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафару 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена портниха и старается помочь мужу для обеспечения семьи. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста. Он очень хорошо обслуживает клиентов, у него всегда чистая машина и поэтому клиентам приятно ездить на его машине. Каждый день он встает рано утром и моет машину и с открытой душой с улыбками на губах он идет на встречу клиентам. Благодаря хорошему сервису у него много клиентов, но последнее время его машина «Опель Вектра» имеет не хорошее состояние и он должен срочно отремонтировать. Если он не сделает ремонт машины, то потеряет клиентов, которых он очень дорожит. Если его бизнес пропадет, то семейное положение будет очень тяжелым, так как доход его жены очень маленькая, и она не может содержать семью. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони  для ремонта машины. Это его второй займ, и он имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Сафар обещает оплатить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Safar is 27 years old. He is married and raising 2 children. His wife is a seamstress and tries to help her husband in providing for the family. The children are not yet adults. In order to provide the family with all necessary means, Safar started his business of providing taxi services 4 years ago. He serves his clients well, he has always a clean car and therefore the clients can have a nice ride in his car. 

Safar gets up early every day and washes his car and with an open mind and a smile on his lips goes to meet his clients. Thanks to his good service he has many clients, but lately his car, an Opel Vectra, has not been in a good condition. He urgently needs to repair it. If he does not repair it, he will lose clients who are very valuable to him. If he loses his business, the family's situation will be very difficult, as his wife's income is very small, and she is not able to support the family. 

Safar requests a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni for the repair of his car. This is his second loan, and he has a good credit history. Safar promises to repay the loan on time. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Ketty

texts.en:
Ketty is 49 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ketty has been working hard to manage her small shop in which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Ketty has requested a loan of 2500000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fashionable clothes for resale and will help Ketty to generate greater profits, take good care of herself, and pay for her medical bills. Ketty hopes that in the future she will be able to own another clothing business in town. 

Ketty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ketty, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулнозе 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень трудолюбивая и активная женщина. С детства она имела большой интерес шитью и кройки. Благодаря родителям она училась у портнихи шитью. Данное время она умелая портниха. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 год назад она начала свой бизнес. Она имеет свой швейный цех и учеников. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она обучает учеников и одновременно обслуживает клиентов. В этом году ее ученики многому научились, и стали ей помогать. Теперь она хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnoza is 19 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She is a very hardworking and active woman.  She has had a lot of interest in sewing and cutting since childhood.  Thanks to her parents, she studied sewing from a seamstress.  Gulnoza is currently a capable seamstress.  To provide the family with all of the necessities, she started her own business four years ago.  She has her own sewing factory and apprentices.  Thanks to a good service, she has a wide circle of clients.  She teaches apprentices and serves her customers at the same time.  This year, her students learned a lot and started to help her.  Now she wants to expand her business.  She needs a new sewing machine for this, but her income does not allow her to purchase it.  Gulnoza is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to purchase a new sewing machine.  She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru:
Ахмадчон мужчина в возрасте 40 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Жена Ахмадчона домохозяйка, занимается только воспитанием детей. Ахмадчон очень трудолюбивый и очень ответственный человек. Он очень много старается работать чтобы его семья не в чем не нуждалась.
 Так как в свое время Ахмадчон не смог получить образования, он вынужден занимается продажей ниток. По его рассказам этот бизнес дает хороший доход. Поэтому Ахмадчон старается развивать свой бизнес так как это единственный доход в семье.
 На полученный кредит Ахмадчон хочет закупить нитки и веревки. Он надеется, что с помощью этого кредита сможет осуществить свои планы. Весной он планирует выдать свою старшую дочь замуж, поэтому он купит нитки и до весны накопит деньги на проведения этого мероприятия. Ахмадчон очень благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon is a man of 40 years. He is married and has children. Ahmadjon's wife is a homemaker and is mostly concerned with raising the children. Ahmadjon is a very hardworking and responsible person. He tries to work a lot in order for his family not to need for anything. 

Since in his time Ahmadjon could not get an education, he has been engaged in selling yarn. According to his stories, this business provides a good income. Therefore, Ahmadjon is trying to develop this business as this is the only source of income for the family. 

With the credit received, Ahmadjon wants to buy yarn and rope. He hopes that, with the help of this loan, he will be able to realize his plans. In the spring, he plans to give his eldest daughter in marriage, so he is buying thread and to save money until spring for the event. Ahmadjon is very grateful to Kiva for the financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy yarn and rope

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.ru:
Анастасия великолепная женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Ей 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Все ее дети не совершеннолетние. Ее муж очень добрый человек и работает в строительской бригаде. Он рядовой строитель и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для содержания 3 детей. С целью улучшения условия проживания более 4 года она работает в одной из средних школ своего города в качестве технички. Она очень хорошо выполняет свою функцию и поэтому все ученики знают ее как «тетю чистюлю». Ей нравится, когда она слышит этот отзыв от учеников. Зарплата Анастасии маленькая и это зарплата не хватает для покупки всех не обходимых средств, а также для ремонта. Она вместе семьей живет в старом доме, которое не отвечает стандартам жилья. Пол ее дома, вся в дырах и она срочно должна установить другой пол, так как каждый раз от туда вылезают тараканы.  
Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, доски для установки пола.   Этот займ поможет ей отремонтировать дом и таким образом принесет уют и комфорт в ее доме. Будущим у нее много планов, как покупки новой техники для дома, так и мягкого мебели. Анастасия и ее дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Anastasiya is a wonderful woman with a beautiful soul and beautiful thoughts.  She is 31 years old, married and raising three children.  All of her children are adolescents.  Her husband is a very kind person, who works on a construction crew.  He is an ordinary construction worker and earns a small salary, which is not enough to support three children.  To improve their living conditions, Anastasiya has been working as a janitor at one of the secondary schools in her town for over four years.  She does her work very well, and this is why all of the students know her as "auntie cleanness."  She likes when she hears this response from the students.  Anastasiya's salary is small and not sufficient to purchase all of the necessary items or for repairs.  She and her family live in an old house that does not meet the minimum living standards.  The floor of her house has holes, and she needs to urgently install another floor because roaches come out of the holes all the time.  Anastasiya is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 somoni to purchase construction materials in order to install the floor.  This loan will help her to repair her house; thus, bringing convenience and comfort to her house.  She has a lot of plans for the future, such as buying new technology for home and furniture.  Anastasiya and her children will wait for kind creditors to help them resolve the housing problem.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to install the floor

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru:
Розие 65 лет. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Ее дочь работает в Российской Федерации трудовым мигрантом, а сын в мастерской для ремонта автомашин. 
У нее очень трудная судьба, так как муж ее бросил и женился на другой, и он даже не обеспечивал детей. Она работала на разных местах и ели-ели зарабатывала на жизнь. Она очень с трудом вырастила своих детей. Данное время ее дети не в состоянии обеспечить свою мать, и поэтому Розия планирует организовать свой бизнес. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес производством лепешки. Лепешки имеют большой спрос среди населения, и она вполне может развевать свой бизнес. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки муки и угля, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Roziya is 65 years old. She is divorced and has two adult children. Her daughter works in the Russian Federation as a labor migrant, and her son works in an automobile repair shop. 

She has a very difficult life as her husband left her and married someone else, and he did not provide anything for the children. She has worked in different places and made hand-to-mouth a living. With much difficulty, she raised her children. 

Her children are not able to provide for their mother and so Roziya is planning to start a business. To that end, she took the "Bring It On" course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she may well start her own business and become successful in this field. She wants to organize a business making flatbreads. Flatbreads have great demand among the population and she may well develop a successful business. 

With the income, she plans to provide her children with nutritious foods. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Somoni to buy flour and coal to establish the new business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy flour and coal for organizing a new business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. María Cristina continúa dedicándose al negocio de su restaurante y servicio de catering. María Cristina en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar vajilla y cubertería  en general para renovar su servicio de catering, la cual le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio  a sus clientes. María Cristina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y expandirse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María Cristina is a member of the "Qorichuspas" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. María Cristina continues to work in her restaurant and catering business. 

On this occasion, María Cristina is applying for a loan in order to buy crockery and cutlery in general, so that she can renew her catering business, which will allow her to offer better service to her customers. 

María Cristina is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to develop as a person and expand her business, which represents her main source of income for supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy crockery and cutlery.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two attending school. She is not looking after any other family member.
She has been selling green bananas in the market at retail for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy baskets of fish because she wants to start selling fish as well. Her challenges include unstable prices and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business and employ other people. She joined MCDT because of timely loans. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells livestock feed. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more feed to sell and will help Paul generate greater profits to pay his children's school fees. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to become the richest man in town. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more feed to sell.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is 35-year-old father of two children. He lives in Mrgavet village of Ararat region with his wife and children. Samvel is involved in agriculture which helps him earn a monthly income. But the income is not enough to cover the family's everyday expenses. So, together with his wife, Samvel decided to start a new business.  He has requested this loan to purchase materials for building a greenhouse. He will plant different kinds of seeds in his greenhouse and sell the harvested products locally. This new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 30-year-old teacher, school proprietor, and single mother of two, in Mshomoroni, Mombasa, Kenya. She has been in the business of providing education for the past eight years, and she is doing well. 

She will use the requested loan to renovate the classrooms. She plans to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. 

This will be her fourth loan; the previous ones were repaid successfully. Alice hopes to brighten the future of her children.

loans.use: To renovate the classrooms

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, a father of three, is a landlord and welder in Mukuru, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. He also participates in community projects that aim to improve the quality of life of Mukuru residents.
